sen.j: 初世浜村蔵六（はつせ はまむら ぞうろく、男性、享保20年（1735年） - 寛政6年11月4日 (旧暦)（1794年11月26日））は、江戸時代中期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Zoroku HAMAMURA, the first (male, 1735-November 26, 1794) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the middle of the Edo period.
Zoroku HAMAMURA, the first (male, 1735-November 26, 1794) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the middle of the Edo period.
Zoroku HAMAMURA, the first (male, 1735 - November 26, 1794) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 5代に亙って篆刻家を輩出した浜村蔵六の祖。
sen.e: The founder of the generations of Zoroku HAMAMURA which had five generations of tenkokuka.
The founder of the generations of Zoroku HAMAMURA which had five generations of tenkokuka.
The founder of the generations of Zoroku HAMAMURA which had five generations of tenkokuka.

sen.j: 本姓は橘氏、名を茂喬、字は君樹、蔵六は号 (称号)。
sen.e: His main name was the Tachibana clan, name was 茂喬, azana (adult male's nickname) was 君樹, and Zoroku was his second name or alias.
His main name was the Tachibana clan, name was 茂喬, azana (adult male's nickname) was 君樹, and Zoroku was his second name or alias.
His main name was the Tachibana clan, name was 茂喬, azana (adult male's nickname) was 君樹, and Zoroku was his second name or alias.

sen.j: 通称浜村六蔵。
sen.e: His common name was Rokuzo HAMAMURA.
His common name was Rokuzo HAMAMURA.
His common name was Rokuzo HAMAMURA.

sen.j: 橘茂喬とも称される。
sen.e: Also called as 橘茂喬.
Also called as 橘茂喬.
Also called as 橘茂喬.

sen.j: 武蔵国葛飾生まれ。
sen.e: Born in Katsushika, Musashi Province.
Born in Katsushika, Musashi Province.
Born in Katsushika, Musashi Province.

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief biography
Brief biography
Brief biography

sen.j: 祖父の道綜の代に伊勢国度会町から江戸に移り住む。
sen.e: During the time of his grandfather 道綜, the family moved to Edo from Watarai-cho, Ise Province.
During the time of his grandfather 道綜, the family moved to Edo from Watarai-cho, Ise Province.
During the time of his grandfather 道綜, the family moved to Edo from Watarai-cho, Ise Province.

sen.j: 父通寿、母関岡氏の長子として生まれる。
sen.e: Born as the eldest child to father 通寿 and mother 関岡氏.
Born as the eldest child to father 通寿 and mother 関岡氏.
Born as the eldest child to father 通寿 and mother 関岡氏.

sen.j: 若いうちから篆刻で著名な高芙蓉を敬慕し、京都に出て芙蓉の門下となる。
sen.e: Since when he was very young, Zoroku adored Fuyo KO, who was famous for his tenkoku (seal-engraving), and went to Kyoto to become his disciple.
From a young age, Zoroku adored Fuyo KO, who was famous for his tenkoku (seal-engraving), and went to Kyoto to become his disciple.
sen.cmt: Since when he was very young→Since whenは「～の内から」という意味にはならず、「いつから～なのか？」という疑問文の中で使うようなので、From a young ageに訂正しました。
sen.e: From a young age, Zoroku adored Fuyo KO, who was famous for his tenkoku (seal-engraving), and went to Kyoto to become his disciple.

sen.j: その印法を学び、奥義を究める。
sen.e: Zoroku learned his inho (sealing way) and mastered the heart of philosophy.
Zoroku learned his inho (sealing way) and mastered the heart of philosophy.
Zoroku learned his inho (sealing way) and mastered the heart of philosophy.

sen.j: 後に江戸に戻り、芙蓉の日本の篆刻史と称される篆刻を伝え、その指導的な役割を担う。
sen.e: Afterward, he returned to Edo, taught Fuyo's tenkoku, which was referred to as the history of Japanese seal engraving, and played a leading role.
Afterward, he returned to Edo, taught Fuyo's tenkoku, which was referred to as the history of Japanese seal engraving, and played a leading role.
Afterward, he returned to Edo, taught Fuyo's tenkoku, which was referred to as the history of Japanese seal engraving, and played a leading role.

sen.j: 篆刻の技術はすこぶる巧みで特に鋳造印を得意とした。
sen.e: His tenkoku technique was masterly and especially he was good at making casting seals.
His tenkoku technique was masterly and especially he was good at making casting seals.
His tenkoku technique was masterly and especially he was good at making casting seals.

sen.j: 法帖の模刻にも巧みで、王寵の『白茆帖』の模刻は絶技と評された。
sen.e: He was also good at mokoku (to engrave letters in order to print on paper), and his mokoku of "白茆帖" by Wang chong was praised as brilliant technique.

He was also good at mokoku (to engrave letters in order to print on paper) of copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy, and his mokoku of "白茆帖" by Chong WANG was praised as brilliant technique.
sen.cmt: 「法帖の」の訳漏れを訂正しました。Wang chong→Chong WANG に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was also good at mokoku (to engrave letters in order to print on paper) of copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy, and his mokoku of "白茆帖" by Chong WANG was praised as brilliant technique.

sen.j: 朴訥で社交的な性格だったという。
sen.e: He was quiet but social person.
He was a quiet but social person.
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞aを補足しました。
sen.e: He was a quiet but social person.

sen.j: 天明4年（1784年）、芙蓉は江戸に出てすぐに没してしまう。
sen.e: In 1784, Fuyo died soon after he went to Edo.
In 1784, Fuyo died soon after he went to Edo.
In 1784, Fuyo died soon after he went to Edo.

sen.j: 蔵六は大典顕常に芙蓉の墓碑銘の撰文を請い、それを韓天寿が書し、蔵六が刻した。
sen.e: Zoroku asked Kenjo DAITEN to select an epitaph on the tombstone, and Tenju KAN wrote it, which was engraved by Zoroku.
Zoroku asked Kenjo DAITEN to select an epitaph on the tombstone of Fuyo, and Tenju KAN wrote it, which was engraved by Zoroku.
sen.cmt: 「芙蓉の」の訳漏れを訂正しました。
sen.e: Zoroku asked Kenjo DAITEN to select an epitaph on the tombstone of Fuyo, and Tenju KAN wrote it, which was engraved by Zoroku.

sen.j: この墓碑はなんらかの事情で蔵六の存命中は建立されず、後に稲毛屋山と二世浜村蔵六によって江戸小石川無量院に建立された。
sen.e: This gravestone was for some reason not built while Zoroku was alive, and later Okuzan INAGE and Zoroku HAMAMURA the second built it in Koishikawa muryo-in Shrine in Edo.
This gravestone was for some reason not built while Zoroku was alive, and later Okuzan INAGE and Zoroku HAMAMURA the second built it in Koishikawa muryo-in Shrine in Edo.
This gravestone was for some reason not built while Zoroku was alive, and later Okuzan INAGE and Zoroku HAMAMURA the second built it in Koishikawa muryo-in Shrine in Edo.

sen.j: 現在は天徳寺（東京都港区 (東京都)虎ノ門3丁目）に移されている。
sen.e: At present the gravestone is moved to Tentoku-ji Temple (3-chome, Toranomon, Minato Ward, Tokyo (Tokyo Prefecture)).
At present the gravestone is moved to Tentoku-ji Temple (3-chome, Toranomon, Minato Ward, Tokyo [Tokyo Prefecture]).
At present the gravestone is moved to Tentoku-ji Temple (3-chome, Toranomon, Minato Ward, Tokyo [Tokyo Prefecture]).

sen.j: 寛政6年11月、江戸で没する。
sen.e: Died in November 1794 in Edo.
Died in November 1794 in Edo.
Died in November 1794 in Edo.

sen.j: 享年61。
sen.e: Died at the age of 61.
Died at the age of 61.
Died at the age of 61.

sen.j: 戒名称樹院壇誉蔵六大徳。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was 称樹院壇誉蔵六大徳.
sen.cmt: 「称樹院壇誉蔵六大徳」は読み方不明。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was 称樹院壇誉蔵六大徳.
His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was 称樹院壇誉蔵六大徳.

sen.j: 墓所は霊山寺 (東京都墨田区)にあり、二世蔵六・三世浜村蔵六も合葬されている。
sen.e: His grave is located in Ryosen-ji Temple (Sumida Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) and Zoroku HAMAMURA the second and the third are also buried here.
His grave is located in Reizan-ji Temple (Sumida Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) and Zoroku HAMAMURA the second and the third are also buried here.
sen.cmt: Ryosen-ji Temple→墨田区にある霊山寺は「れいざんじ」と読むようなので、そのように訂正しました。
sen.e: His grave is located in Reizan-ji Temple (Sumida Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) and Zoroku HAMAMURA the second and the third are also buried here.

sen.j: なお、この墓石は、関東大震災により紛失した。
sen.e: This grave is lost at the time of the Great Kanto Earthquake.
This gravestone is lost at the time of the Great Kanto Earthquake.
sen.cmt: grave→原文に合わせgravestoneに訂正しました。
sen.e: This gravestone is lost at the time of the Great Kanto Earthquake.
